title: Technology
description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.

items.title: Twitter reports a revenue drop, citing uncertainty over Musk deal and the economy
items.content_html: Twitter's revenue for the quarter fell short of expectations. The social network cited uncertainty about Elon Musk's acquisition and advertisers worried about the economy.
items.summary: Twitter's revenue for the quarter fell short of expectations. The social network cited uncertainty about Elon Musk's acquisition and advertisers worried about the economy.

items.title: COMIC: How living on Mars time taught me to slow down
items.content_html: NASA engineer Nagin Cox lives on Earth but works on Mars time, where days are longer and time works differently. Her work with the rovers has entirely changed the way she thinks about time on Earth.
items.summary: NASA engineer Nagin Cox lives on Earth but works on Mars time, where days are longer and time works differently. Her work with the rovers has entirely changed the way she thinks about time on Earth.

items.title: Tesla cashes out $936 million in Bitcoin, after a year of crypto turbulence
items.content_html: Tesla aggressively embraced Bitcoin in 2021, investing $1.5 billion in the currency. But it now says its profitability was affected by "Bitcoin impairment."
items.summary: Tesla aggressively embraced Bitcoin in 2021, investing $1.5 billion in the currency. But it now says its profitability was affected by "Bitcoin impairment."

items.title: Surreal or too real? Breathtaking AI tool DALL-E takes its images to a bigger stage
items.content_html: The lab behind the artificial intelligence art tool is giving access to up to a million people on its waiting list, just as worries grow about possible abuse.
items.summary: The lab behind the artificial intelligence art tool is giving access to up to a million people on its waiting list, just as worries grow about possible abuse.

items.title: The best games of 2022 so far, picked by the NPR staff
items.content_html: From critical hits like Elden Ring to indie darlings like Tunic, it's been a busy year for video games. NPR staffers and contributors round up their favorites so far.
items.summary: From critical hits like Elden Ring to indie darlings like Tunic, it's been a busy year for video games. NPR staffers and contributors round up their favorites so far.

items.title: Netflix loses nearly 1 million subscribers. That's the good news
items.content_html: The streaming service had forecast that it would lose 2 million subscribers. The less severe loss, combined with a projection of growth in July to September, helped lift Netflix's battered stock.
items.summary: The streaming service had forecast that it would lose 2 million subscribers. The less severe loss, combined with a projection of growth in July to September, helped lift Netflix's battered stock.

items.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk will go to trial in October
items.content_html: A Delaware judge ruled the trial will last for five days in October, giving Twitter an early victory in its legal battle against the Tesla CEO. The company had argued that any delay would hurt it.
items.summary: A Delaware judge ruled the trial will last for five days in October, giving Twitter an early victory in its legal battle against the Tesla CEO. The company had argued that any delay would hurt it.

items.title: Meet the new GDP prototype that tracks inequality
items.content_html: A team of economists offers America a new way to look at economic growth. It's a sort of GDP prototype that tracks the well-being of different income groups.
items.summary: A team of economists offers America a new way to look at economic growth. It's a sort of GDP prototype that tracks the well-being of different income groups.

items.title: This app compares Hubble and Webb images — the differences are astronomical
items.content_html: Software developer John Christensen coded an app to show you just how far NASA innovation has come since Hubble.
items.summary: Software developer John Christensen coded an app to show you just how far NASA innovation has come since Hubble.

items.title: How to protect your privacy when using mental health care apps
items.content_html: Some online therapy companies are facing scrutiny for how they handle user data. Experts weigh in on what patients can do to keep their data safer when using these types of services.
items.summary: Some online therapy companies are facing scrutiny for how they handle user data. Experts weigh in on what patients can do to keep their data safer when using these types of services.

items.title: Lofi Girl disappeared from YouTube and reignited debate over bogus copyright claims
items.content_html: When YouTube took the Lofi Girl stream down by mistake, fans were not happy. It was the latest episode in an ongoing debate over copyright and bogus claims.
items.summary: When YouTube took the Lofi Girl stream down by mistake, fans were not happy. It was the latest episode in an ongoing debate over copyright and bogus claims.

items.title: When it comes to data on your phone, deleting a text isn't the end of the story
items.content_html: The Secret Service may have deleted texts that were being sought by a government investigator. But data on a device isn't necessarily gone when it's been deleted.
items.summary: The Secret Service may have deleted texts that were being sought by a government investigator. But data on a device isn't necessarily gone when it's been deleted.

items.title: A super fan collected every Super Nintendo game manual and made them free
items.content_html: Kerry Hays has crowdsourced the manuals for upwards of 850 unique Super Nintendo games and made them free on an online archive.
items.summary: Kerry Hays has crowdsourced the manuals for upwards of 850 unique Super Nintendo games and made them free on an online archive.

items.title: Making Space Travel Accessible For People With Disabilities
items.content_html:
This week NASA released some of the sharpest images of space ever from the James Webb Space Telescope. The telescope's camera gives us a glimpse into distant galaxies and a picture of the makings of our universe.

Tomorrow, we'll nerd out about those photos.

But today, we're revisiting the idea of space travel. This encore episode, science correspondent Geoff Brumfiel talks to New York Times Disability Reporting Fellow Amanda Morris about one organization working to ensure disabled people have the chance to go to space.

You can always reach the show by emailing shortwave@npr.org.
items.summary: This week NASA released some of the sharpest images of space ever from the James Webb Space Telescope. The telescope's camera gives us a glimpse into distant galaxies and a picture of the makings of our universe. Tomorrow, we'll nerd out about those photos. But today, we're revisiting the idea of space travel. This encore episode, science correspondent Geoff Brumfiel talks to New York Times Disability Reporting Fellow Amanda Morris about one organization working to ensure disabled people have the chance to go to space.You can always reach the show by emailing shortwave@npr.org.

items.title: A former CIA engineer is convicted in a massive theft of secrets released by WikiLeaks
items.content_html: Joshua Schulte, who represented himself in his retrial, told jurors that the CIA and FBI made him a scapegoat for an embarrassing public release of a trove of CIA secrets by WikiLeaks in 2017.
items.summary: Joshua Schulte, who represented himself in his retrial, told jurors that the CIA and FBI made him a scapegoat for an embarrassing public release of a trove of CIA secrets by WikiLeaks in 2017.

items.title: A centuries-old court in Delaware will decide if Elon Musk has to buy Twitter
items.content_html: In a lawsuit, Twitter has asked the Delaware Court of Chancery to order the Tesla CEO to follow through with a $44 billion takeover bid for the social media company.
items.summary: In a lawsuit, Twitter has asked the Delaware Court of Chancery to order the Tesla CEO to follow through with a $44 billion takeover bid for the social media company.

items.title: GLAAD gives social media giants poor grades over lack of protections for LGBTQ users
items.content_html: In a new report, GLAAD found that 84% of LGBTQ adults said not enough protections are on social media to prevent discrimination, harassment or disinformation.
items.summary: In a new report, GLAAD found that 84% of LGBTQ adults said not enough protections are on social media to prevent discrimination, harassment or disinformation.

items.title: Twitter takes Elon Musk to court, accusing him of bad faith and hypocrisy
items.content_html: The social media company is asking a Delaware court to force the world's richest man to follow through on his agreement to buy it for $44 billion.
items.summary: The social media company is asking a Delaware court to force the world's richest man to follow through on his agreement to buy it for $44 billion.

items.title: Lean Out: Employees Are Accepting Lower Pay In Order To Work Remotely
items.content_html: A new study finds American companies are using remote work as a way to avoid giving workers raises; so much so that it's helping to moderate inflation.
items.summary: A new study finds American companies are using remote work as a way to avoid giving workers raises; so much so that it's helping to moderate inflation.

items.title: 'Smart gun' innovators seek to reduce firearm deaths
items.content_html: Can technological innovation offer solutions to gun fatalities in the absence of major policy reform? Gun safety innovators are developing "smart guns" that unlock only for their registered users.
items.summary: Can technological innovation offer solutions to gun fatalities in the absence of major policy reform? Gun safety innovators are developing "smart guns" that unlock only for their registered users.

items.title: Twitter has vowed to sue Elon Musk. Here's what could happen in court
items.content_html: Musk and Twitter accused each other of breaking the legal agreement in the $44 billion sale of the social network to the billionaire.
items.summary: Musk and Twitter accused each other of breaking the legal agreement in the $44 billion sale of the social network to the billionaire.

items.title: Privacy advocates fear Google will be used to prosecute abortion seekers
items.content_html: When law enforcement requests it, Google usually hands over location and search data collected through its smartphone apps. Will that now be used against people seeking abortions in some states?
items.summary: When law enforcement requests it, Google usually hands over location and search data collected through its smartphone apps. Will that now be used against people seeking abortions in some states?

items.title: Uber lobbied and used 'stealth' tech to block scrutiny, according to a new report
items.content_html: A nonprofit network of investigative reporters details charges of how the ride-sharing service pushed into markets around the world as a company spokesperson acknowledged "mistakes'' in the past.
items.summary: A nonprofit network of investigative reporters details charges of how the ride-sharing service pushed into markets around the world as a company spokesperson acknowledged "mistakes'' in the past.
